member.summary: The current value of the component.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.Invalid
member.summary: Control the validity of the control.

member.name: M:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.StepUpAsync(System.Double)
member.summary: Increments the value of the slider by `stepIncrement * step`, where `stepIncrement` defaults to 1. stepIncrement Optional step increment. If no parameter is passed, it defaults to 1.
member.param: Optional step increment. If no parameter is passed, it defaults to 1.

member.name: M:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.StepDownAsync(System.Double)
member.summary: Decrements the value of the slider by `stepDecrement * step`, where `stepDecrement` defaults to 1. stepDecrement Optional step decrement. If no parameter is passed, it defaults to 1.
member.param: Optional step decrement. If no parameter is passed, it defaults to 1.

member.name: M:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.ReportValidityAsync
member.summary: Checks for validity of the control and shows the browser message if it invalid.

member.name: M:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.CheckValidityAsync
member.summary: Checks for validity of the control and emits the invalid event if it invalid.

member.name: M:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSlider.SetCustomValidityAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom validation message for the control. As long as `message` is not empty, the control is considered invalid.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 0. If `min` is greater than `max` the call is a no-op. If `labels` are provided (projected), then `min` is always set to 0. If `lowerBound` ends up being less than than the current `min` value, it is automatically assigned the new `min` value.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the slider scale. Defaults to 100. If `max` is less than `min` the call is a no-op. If `labels` are provided (projected), then `max` is always set to the number of labels. If `upperBound` ends up being greater than than the current `max` value, it is automatically assigned the new `max` value.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.LowerBound
member.summary: The lower bound of the slider value. If not set, the `min` value is applied.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.UpperBound
member.summary: The upper bound of the slider value. If not set, the `max` value is applied.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.Disabled
member.summary: Disables the UI interactions of the slider.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.DiscreteTrack
member.summary: Marks the slider track as discrete so it displays the steps. If the `step` is 0, the slider will remain continuos even if `discreteTrack` is `true`.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.HideTooltip
member.summary: Hides the thumb tooltip.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.Step
member.summary: Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to. If set to 0 no stepping is implied and any value in the range is allowed. If `labels` are provided (projected) then the step is always assumed to be 1 since it is a discrete slider.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.PrimaryTicks
member.summary: The number of primary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no primary ticks are displayed.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.SecondaryTicks
member.summary: The number of secondary ticks. It defaults to 0 which means no secondary ticks are displayed.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.TickOrientation
member.summary: Changes the orientation of the ticks.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.HidePrimaryLabels
member.summary: Hides the primary tick labels.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.HideSecondaryLabels
member.summary: Hides the secondary tick labels.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.Locale
member.summary: The locale used to format the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.ValueFormat
member.summary: String format used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

member.summary: The degrees for the rotation of the tick labels. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbSliderBase.ValueFormatOptions
member.summary: Number format options used for the thumb and tick label values in the slider.

member.summary: A base class for indicator series with simple calculations that separates the calculation responsibility from the other responsibilities of the financial series, this enables easier unit testing and decoupling of individual calculation strategies.
member.remarks: A contract is defined between the financial series and these simple indicator calculations detailing the data which the series agrees to provide the simple indicator calculations, this contract is defined by FinancialCalculationDataSource. If more complex interactions are needed between the indicator calculation and the series, the indicators should instead derive from FinancialIndicator directly, or some derivative other than StrategyBasedIndicator

member.name: T:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTextarea
member.summary: This element represents a multi-line plain-text editing control, useful when you want to allow users to enter a sizeable amount of free-form text, for example a comment on a review or feedback form.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTextarea.Autocomplete
member.summary: Specifies what if any permission the browser has to provide for automated assistance in filling out form field values, as well as guidance to the browser as to the type of information expected in the field. Refer to [this page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for additional information.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTextarea.Autocapitalize
member.summary: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user. [MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize).

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTextarea.InputMode
member.summary: Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. This allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard. [MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/inputmode)

member.summary: The minimum number of characters (UTF-16 code units) required that the user should enter.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTextarea.Rows
member.summary: The number of visible text lines for the control. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer. If it is not specified, the default value is 2.

member.summary: The value of the component

member.name: T:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisBreak
member.summary: Settings for breaks on a time axis.
member.remarks: Axis breaks can be added to a time axis in order to omit portions of time on that axis. For example, weekends can be skipped, if they are not relevant to your data.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisBreak.Start
member.summary: The start time of the axis break.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisBreak.End
member.summary: The end time of the axis break.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisBreak.Interval
member.summary: The interval at which to repeat this break, expressed as a TimeSpan.

member.name: T:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisInterval
member.summary: Settings for an interval on a time axis.
member.remarks: Label intervals can be applied to a time axis, which are dynamic, according to the visible range. During zooming, the visible range of the axis can change, and so a different interval is selected. The interval selected will be the one with the largest range smaller than the visible range of the axis.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisInterval.Range
member.summary: The visible axis range at which to apply this interval.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisInterval.Interval
member.summary: The interval, expressed as a multiple of IntervalType.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisInterval.IntervalType
member.summary: The unit of time for this interval.

member.name: T:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat
member.summary: Settings for a label format on a time axis.
member.remarks: Label formats can be applied to a time axis, which are dynamic, according to the visible range. During zooming, the visible range of the axis can change, and so a different label format is selected. The label format selected will be the one with the largest range smaller than the visible range of the axis.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat.Range
member.summary: The visible axis range at which to apply this label format.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat.Format
member.summary: The DateTime format string to apply.
member.remarks: Some common DateTime format strings are: yyyy, MM/dd/yy, and hh:mm:ss.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat.RepeatedYearFormat
member.summary: The DateTime format string to apply, if the year is repeated from the prior date.
member.remarks: Some common DateTime format strings are: yyyy, MM/dd/yy, and hh:mm:ss.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat.RepeatedMonthFormat
member.summary: The DateTime format string to apply, if the month is repeated from the prior date.
member.remarks: Some common DateTime format strings are: yyyy, MM/dd/yy, and hh:mm:ss.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeAxisLabelFormat.RepeatedDayFormat
member.summary: The DateTime format string to apply, if the day is repeated from the prior date.
member.remarks: Some common DateTime format strings are: yyyy, MM/dd/yy, and hh:mm:ss.

member.name: P:IgniteUI.Blazor.Controls.IgbTimeXAxis.Intervals
